meanings.definition: A person who begs or tries to obtain something for free.
meanings.sent1: The cadgers outside the store were asking for money.
meanings.sent2: The city had many cadgers asking for food on the streets.
meanings.sent3: The group of cadgers decided to ask for donations at the park.
meanings.sent4: The cadgers swarmed the event, hoping for freebies.
meanings.sent5: The image of the cadgers at the market stayed in my mind.

meanings.definition: To beg or obtain something for free.
meanings.sent1: She cadgers for food whenever she visits her grandparents.
meanings.sent2: The homeless man cadgers for spare change every day.
meanings.sent3: He cadgers for snacks from his friends during lunch.
meanings.sent4: The cat cadgers for attention by rubbing against your legs.
meanings.sent5: The child cadgers for toys at the toy store.

meanings.definition: The act of begging or obtaining something for free.
meanings.sent1: His cadgers at the party annoyed the guests.
meanings.sent2: The cadgers at the event were looking for freebies.
meanings.sent3: The cadgers at the concert tried to get free tickets.
meanings.sent4: The cadgers at the charity event hoped for donations.
meanings.sent5: The cadgers at the market were persistent in their requests.
